properties.address: Epping Forest, United Kingdom
properties.description: Supporting Young People We can't run our usual after school sessions during the national lockdown but we can still meet up remotely. Online after school social space is every Thursday at 3:30pm for a half hour catch up and chat. Invitations and links are going out to our regulars and there will be an opportunity for new people to join in the next couple of weeks. ​ The Box Counselling Service continues to offer online and telephone support and referrals can be made using the forms on our counselling page.
properties.title: The Box Epping

properties.address: 2 Wych Elm, Harlow CM20 1QP, UK
properties.description: Streets2Homes is a charity based in Harlow, Essex and we provide a day centre which seeks to reach out to and help homeless people. We provide a safe and friendly environment in which we can assist them in a number of ways including finding accommodation. The demand for housing in this area always outstrips availability so it can take time to find suitable accommodation and we are always looking for good landlords to work with us. The day centre provides a place to access housing advice and practical assistance to secure accommodation, social contact, training sessions, employment advice, health services, washing facilities, food, clothing, general guidance and support. Outreach Our outreach workers respond to reports of rough sleepers by going out on the streets and meeting with them. Inform them of services available, encourage them to come to the centre. Sometimes it takes time to build trust and confidence so this can take several visits until they are ready to come into the centre. We also carry out joint outreach with other agencies such as; DWP to ensure a rough sleeper is getting the benefits they are entitled to and not having to beg for money and food; drug and alcohol treatment teams and mental health teams to engage with rough sleepers and help them access services so they can get help to stay well and safe. We will ensure they have food, water, clothes and warm dry bedding until they are ready to access services. Day Centre Services The day centre provides a safe and friendly environment. We also have showers, clean clothes, refreshments, breakfast, healthy freshly cooked meal, assistance to claim benefits, seek accommodation, training and volunteering opportunities to enhance employability and confidence and life skills. We facilitate several workshop sessions to help with knowledge, confidence and well-being such as an art project, cooking skills, job club, computer club and the opportunity to complete accredited courses. Volunteering at the centre also enables our clients to help shape the services and provide insight to help us plan future projects. Help to seek and secure accommodation We have experienced staff to help find solutions to relieve or prevent homelessness, we have links with many local landlords in the private rented sector and can help remove barriers to securing accommodation through one of our deposit schemes. We also run a weekly tenancy workshop to help people who are struggling with their accommodation or who are seeking alternative accommodation. We hold regular multi-agency meetings with relevant partners to explore options, source suitable accommodation and develop support plans. Prevention of Homelessness The earliest someone is aware they are at risk of losing their accommodation and are at risk of becoming homeless the better, as prevention is far better than cure. We can liaise with the landlord and other agencies, provide mediation, work out repayments for arrears, provide support and assistance to ensure the tenant can stay in property. Warm Space Streets2Homes Day Room is open Monday to Friday 9am to 2pm for a warm welcome as well as teas and coffees for a 50p donation (no fee for homeless). You can find contact details on the Streets2Homes website.
properties.title: Streets2Homes

properties.address: Harlow CM18 6TD, UK
properties.description: Excelcare has announced today that a selection of their care homes in Essex will be opening ‘warm banks’ for people over the age of 65. These warm banks will be free to attend and offer a safe haven for people to seek warmth and relaxation when in need. Excelcare is a family run care provider with homes located across London, Essex, Cambridge and Milton Keynes. Providing person centred care since 1989, this award-winning provider has been at the forefront of the care sector for over 30 years. With the current cost of living crisis crippling families across the UK and the temperature steadily dropping as we approach winter, Excelcare has launched their warm bank initiative to provide support to an age group that are most likely to feel the harsh effects of the cold and rising energy costs. From 11am-4pm, people aged 65 and over will be welcomed into Excelcare homes listed in the graphic to seek refuge from the cold and enjoy a hot drink. The warm banks in each home are situated in communal areas such as lounges and dining rooms, so guests will also have the opportunity to engage with people who live and work in them. This will provide some welcomed company to elderly members of the community, especially those who live on their own or struggle with feelings of loneliness. Precautions are in place to ensure those who currently live and work in the homes remain safe and free from the spread of infection, so upon entry guests will be asked to sanitise their hands, complete a lateral flow test* and wear a face mask for the duration of their visit. Helen Bennett, Regional Operations Director of Excelcare homes in Essex said, “it’s a pleasure to announce the opening of our warm banks in care homes across the region. Providing a safe space for people who are in need this winter is something we have been committed to doing and I am so happy to see this initiative come to life. “I encourage people over the age of 65 to make use of these warm banks and seek refuge in our comfortable homes surrounded by our caring teams.” Warm banks in each of the homes participating will be opening today and closing on March 31st, 2023.
properties.title: Excelcare

properties.address: Harlow CM19 4QT, UK
properties.description: We are open for groups daily. Please see our Facebook page for times. We are based at Paringdon sports club in Harlow. We have a port a cabin, just as you drive in you will see us. Anyone is welcome. We are a friendly group, who are here to listen, talk and help in a non judgemental way. We run, social/support groups, meditation, sound healing, menopause support groups, Chakra dancing, walk and talk, Parent support group, chill n chat (teenagers), Drumming circles, woman's groups, men's groups and also SOBS meetings. We have just received funding for being a warm hub. So we will be open Tuesday and Friday 11am-1pm, Wednesday 10.30am-12pm and every other Sunday 11.30am-1pm. we will offer tea and offer and light snacks. Most of groups are free, if you are struggling we do offer concessions. Donations are always welcome.   Butterfly Effect Wellbeing are providing a warm space at Paringdon Sports Club 11am to 1pm every Tuesday and Friday and every other Sunday 11.30am to 1pm. Drinks and snacks are also provided. You can find contact details on the Butterfly Effect Wellbeing Facebook page.
properties.title: Butterfly Effect WELLbeing

properties.address: Houchin Dr, Walker Ave, Fyfield, Ongar CM5 0RG, UK
properties.description: We are a village hall that helps provide the needs of the residents, this includes hiring the hall to locals at reduces rates for parties, anniversaries, celebrations, residents and club meetings. Clubs and classes using the hall include for children; theatre group, ballet and football. Adult clubs and classes include pilates, yoga, WD50 [ exercise for the elderly and less mobile ], essex sheddies group, vintage bike club, U3A, bridge club, warm room with swapping library, games and activities, refreshments. The catchment area is Fyfield, Willingale, Morton, Chipping Ongar, The hall is available to hire as one large hall, or two smaller with sound proof divider, or a clubroom with bar.
properties.title: fyfield village hall

properties.description: Phoenix community kitchen provides a space that is open to all who may need or want to grab a free breakfast made up of cereal, toast and a hot or cold drink. The immediate aim is to address a rising need in the Harlow community for help with food shortages and hunger- especially among school children, the elderly and those hit by harsh economic times. You can pop by on Thursday, Friday and Saturday from 8.30am-10am, or lunch on Friday and Saturday between 12pm - 2pm on the first floor of the Harvey Centre, next to Greek Retreat
